thread.title: Dogs rescued from South Korea to be available for adoption in...
thread.title_full: Dogs rescued from South Korea to be available for adoption in... | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Dogs rescued from South Korea to be available for adoption in...
text:
Dogs rescued from a meat farm in South Korea will soon be available to adopt in Everett.
Volunteers and staff at the Everett Animal Shelter are working with eight dogs -- getting them ready for adoption.
The dogs arrived at the shelter Sept. 24 and should be ready to adopt the week of Oct. 19.
The dogs are part of the 103 dogs and puppies rescued from a dog meat farm in South Korea. .
The dogs are Tosa mixes, also called Japanese mastiffs.
Check out these cute faces--Dogs rescued from a meat farm in South Korea will be available for adoption in Everett next week.We're putting the story together for 6pm on KIRO 7 News.
Posted by Alison Grande on Wednesday, October 14, 2015 The dogs in Everett range from 7 months old to 5 years old and will grow to weigh between 80 and 130 pounds.
The dogs are not available for the public to view. People interested in adopting the dogs can apply here.
>> More information about the dogs and their adoption, from Everett Animal Services.
The shelter is asking people not to call about the dogs.
Shelter staff and volunteers will select potential adopters from the applications and allow them to meet the dogs to see if they are a good fit.
KIRO 7â€™s Alison Grande is at the Everett Animal Shelter now and is putting the story together for KIRO 7 News at 6 p.m.
